New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the sixth team in NBA history to start a season 13-0
The Cavaliers are the first team since the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors to win 13 straight to begin a season
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 11 points in the final three minutes of the game
Jared McCain had a career-high 34 points for the 76ers
Pre-Game Insights: The game was the second night of a back-to-back for the 76ers as part of left knee injury maintenance for Paul George and Joel Embiid
Post-Match Reflections: No specific post-match reflections were mentioned in the article
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers have won 13 in a row for the fourth time in franchise history
The other three times the Cavaliers won 13 in a row were when they had LeBron James on the roster
Others: No other significant mentions were made in the article
